head.supplied: Melbourne ¶ 5/12/73 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to inform you, that I am anxious, if you approve of it, to proceed for a few days to the Upper Yarra Ranges, to institute there — so far as my present s...

div.p: D73/15681, unit 675, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to inform you, that I am anxious, if you approve of it, to proceed for a few days to the Upper Yarra Ranges, to institute there — so far as my present state of health admits of it — some observations in connection with my Departmental researches.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
The honorable the Chief Secretary
Francis approved the journey on 9 December and on 11 December M replied saying he would leave that day.
